item.title: Report E-2025010046
item.description:
Report E-2025010046

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-06
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 24500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:57 PM ET, UDV contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred over the road, near 5500 Lincoln St. in Denver, CO. The spill consists of approximately 75 gallons of a UN1719 corrosive liquid, trade name unknown, which spilled from 1-270 gallon plastic tote. The driver was cut off by another vehicle and had to make a sharp turn, causing the tote to suffer a large puncture across the middle. The driver stated the tote was properly secured and strapped in, and they believe the spill was due to package failure. The spill has impacted the floor of the trailer and has spilled out onto the asphalt below the trailer. The tote is no longer actively leaking. ERTS will dispatch for assistance. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 250-gallons of UN1719 product released to a 180’x20’ area of the trailer floor, asphalt, concrete and drain due to load shift. The contractors cleaned the release with absorbents, recollected, and containerized the release into drums, (2) CUYD containing floor dry impacted with product, (2) 275-gallon totes containing impacted rinsewater from the drains, (2) 55-gallon plastic drums containing transferred product only, (1) 55-gallon plastic drum contained impacted PPE, debris, poly sheeting, floor dry, spent absorbents and straps and (1) 65-gallon metal drum containing impacted absorbents, trash bags, and PPE and (2) 55-gallon plastic drums containing cut up totes. The waste was picked up and taken to a waste management facility.
